title: The English secretorie VVherin is contayned, a perfect method, for the inditing of all manner of epistles and familiar letters, together with their diuersities, enlarged by examples vnder their seuerall tytles. In which is layd forth a path-waye, so apt, plaine and easie, to any learners capacity, as the like wherof hath not at any time heretofore beene deliuered. Nowe first deuized, and newly published by Angel Daye.
author: Day, Angel, fl. 1575-1595.
publisher: Printed by Robert Walde-graue, and are to be solde by Richard Iones, dwelling at the signe of the Rose and the Crowne, neere vnto Holburn Bridge,
